intro: Thelypodium simplex, commonly known as the slender thelypodium, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges. It is an herbaceous perennial that produces small, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds. Thelypodium simplex is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of light conditions.
